page.title: 19TOURISM
page.content: Village is situated at the edge of the {Yorkshire Dales} and is also within easy travelling distance of the South {Lake District} ( Kendal being only 21 miles away ). It is a good holiday centre, especially for climbers and walkers. There are good{caravan sites nearby. Ingleborough, Whernside & Pen-y-Ghent are only a few miles away and provide good { fell-walking} and {pot-holing} ( There is good salmon and trout{fishing} in the River Lune and its tributary, the River Greta, which runs through the village. There are several{ holiday cottages} in the village, let from March to October, and some are also let in the winter months, sometimes to Staff from Lancaster University. Some homes have been purchased for week-end use and eventually for retirement.
